analysis_steps.description: Starting file structure and organization analysis
JSON parsing failed, retrying... Error: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)

consistency_issues: Mixed use of uppercase and lowercase
Unclear relation between similarly named files

recommended_conventions.directories: Functional grouping by file type and purpose
recommended_conventions.configuration: Clear separation of code, queries, and documentation

modularity_assessment.coupling_analysis: High - files appear interdependent with unclear boundaries
modularity_assessment.cohesion_analysis: Poor - mixed content types and purposes in flat structure

configuration_management.security_assessment: High risk - potential embedded credentials in SQL and SAS files
recommendations: Create separate directories for SQL, SAS, and documentation
Implement version control with .gitignore for sensitive data
Document relationships between files in comprehensive README

build_and_deployment.testing_structure: Missing - no test files or structure detected

improvement_opportunities.action: Restructure project into logical directories (sql/, sas/, docs/)
Create comprehensive README explaining project purpose and file relationships
improvement_opportunities.impact: Enables new developers to understand project structure

improvement_opportunities.action: Standardize file naming conventions across all files
improvement_opportunities.impact: Improves discoverability and understanding of file purposes

improvement_opportunities.action: Break large files into smaller, purpose-specific modules
improvement_opportunities.impact: Improves maintainability and enables parallel development

improvement_opportunities.action: Audit SQL and SAS files for hardcoded credentials

ideal_structure_suggestion.sql/: All SQL queries organized by function
ideal_structure_suggestion.sas/: All SAS code files with clear naming
ideal_structure_suggestion.config/: Configuration parameters extracted from code files
ideal_structure_suggestion.README.md: Comprehensive project overview, purpose and usage instructions
